subject: Fashion
title: Rayon's Identity Crisis
description: A micro-lesson that makes Rayon's Identity Crisis usable.

hook.text: Is rayon natural or synthetic? Even experts argue about it.

buildup.text: Rayon starts as wood pulpâ€”a natural sourceâ€”then gets dissolved in chemicals.

discovery.text: The result drapes like silk, breathes like cotton, but is chemically processed.

twist.text: Traditional rayon production dumps toxic solvents into waterways.

climax.text: Lyocell (Tencel) fixed this with a closed-loop process recycling 99% of solvent.

punchline.text: Same raw material. Cleaner process. Huge difference.
